data.question: What is the chemical formula for the 3-D SHG-active MOF material discussed?
What is the role of the chiral triple helices in the MOF material?
data.answer: They account for the noncentrosymmetric space group.

data.question: Is Ag-Amidn (1) soluble in water?
What property makes Ag-Amidn (1) a potential candidate for second-order NLO materials?
data.answer: Its high thermal stability and insolubility.

data.question: What is the yield percentage of Ag-Amidn (1) when synthesized?
Does the SHG intensity of Ag-Amidn (1) depend on the particle size?
What is the maximum temperature Ag-Amidn (1) can withstand before degrading, as indicated by TGA analysis?
What is the topological structure of Ag-Amidn (1)?
Are there any other 3-D SHG Ag-MOF materials reported before Ag-Amidn (1)?
What is the crystal space group of Ag-Amidn (1)?
Does the SHG efficiency of Ag-Amidn (1) exceed that of potassium dihydrogen phosphate (KDP)?
What is the significance of the donor–acceptor system in Ag-Amidn (1)?
data.answer: It contributes to the impressive SHG activity.

data.question: What type of ligand was employed to synthesize Ag-Amidn (1)?
Is the coordination polymer chemistry of HAmidn extensively studied?
What method is used for SHG measurement of Ag-Amidn (1)?
Does the SHG intensity of Ag-Amidn (1) reach a plateau with increasing particle size?
What is the role of the amino (–NH2) group in the ligand used for Ag-Amidn (1)?
data.answer: It provides a polar bond, a potential ligating and hydrogen bonding site, and a chance of functionalization.

data.question: What is the SHG efficiency of Ag-Amidn (1) compared to KDP?
Are the triple helices in Ag-Amidn (1) symmetric?
What is the significance of using d10 metal ions in the fabrication of NLO-active MOFs?
data.answer: To avoid unwanted d–d transitions in the visible region.
